CFRA is entitled to their opinion about the future no matter how ill-informed. My own analysis suggests the next two years are going to be a period of sustained growth of at least 30% in unit shipments of modules, relatively stable pricing because of limited poly silicon supply and growing concentration of market share, and therefore IMPROVING gross margins which could exceed 20% by 2022. Also JKS is now a vertically integrated module maker which means they capture internally all the margin that goes to the wafer makers.As a result $5.00 in 2021 earnings is conservative, $6.00 is likely and $7.00 is possible.Similarly in 2022, $7.00 is conservative, $8.00 is likely, and $9.00 is possible.As this improving margin and earnings picture unfolds, I think the P/E multiple will expand as well. Stocks like ENPH and DQ have demonstrated that when margins expand, out of favor stocks with low multiples can experience MASSIVE multiple expansion. So a 20X multiple is definitely in JKS’ future.

Yup, also confirmed in the PPT slide deck graphic. They had 31 GW capacity at end of June, and if they get close to the 30GW high-end prediction (I consider that unlikely, but would be very happy with 28 GW), it would be a fairly decent utilization rate compared to the industry average. Even if the added no further capacity in 2022, it would imply that Jinko could be selling close to about $10B worth of products by the end of 2022. For how much longer can the shorts keep them at around the ridiculous $2B market cap?

US shareholders own ZERO of the company. The ADS shares of Chinese companies are structured that way that they do NOT own any part of the company. So if Junko or Daqo decides to pull out of the US stock market they can do that with US shareholders getting ZERO. There is a great article about that on WSJ. I suggest you guys read it.

As a US citizen I like the idea of being self sufficient when it comes to transitioning to renewable energy. However, won't this further delay our transition to solar? also, eith Jinko having ties to US already, why are we suffering the largest drop from this news? I'm still long, just asking why.

Jinkosolar is a totally undervalued stock!Here are the facts:Jinkosolar is the world leader (number one in China, Middle East, Australia and Europe and number 2/3 in the US) in the solar module business. Furthermore, this company is also technology leader for monocrysaline PV modules. It was the first vertical integrated PV module producer in the world, which covers the whole process (wafer, cells, modules). Adding to this, the company is massivley expanding its business into new areas (they are one of the biggest solar project companies, e.g. they finalized currently the 1 billion US$ project in VAE in conneciton with EDF, which will lead to the sale of 4 Million modules in 2021) and into the battery energy storage. They started to sell it in December!). As China, Europe etc. are moving to renewables as well as the situation that more and more countries reach grid parity, the company still invests massivley into the expansion of the production facilites to cover the demand, which will lead to massiv growth in the near future. Furthermore, the massiv push of countries into the hydrogen economy will also lead to growth of the solar sector. The only useful hydrogen production will be "green hydrogen" produced by solar or wind. Adding to this, the PV producer market has already gone through a major consolidation. While companies like Sunedision, Solarworld or Q-Cells went bancrupt, the five biggest PV producer of the world already have a marketshare of around 70%. They will dominate the ASPs in the near future, which will be beneficial for the margins.This company is only 15 years old, but will make already 5 billion revenues in 2020 and grows by around 20% at the moment. They earn money; Ebitda positiv by around 700-750 million in 2020 and 150 mill net (before currency valuations). Even as the margins came under pressure due to some raw material shortages....this will be over in the coming months, as new solar glass and polysilicon facilities come online (refer to CEO of Daqo and Trina Solar). The stock valuation of Jinkosolar is ridicolous compared to hydrogen companies or some solar companies, like Sunpower (which will miss the future, except TOTAL will fully buy it!) or First Solar. If you would compare it to a PLUG POWER, Jinko should be traded by around 1.500 US$, while if you would take First Solar (which is smaller than Jinkosolar) into account, the company should be valued by around 250 US$.The stock increase of 120% in 2020 was ok, but I really look forward to 2021, especially since the IPO of the project daughter will also lead to an increase of the valuation. This company is already valued in the "road show" process by around 4 billion US$, which would be more of the 3 billion, which Jinko is traded at the moment. Totally long and bullish!

Jinko has set up this year's sales in such a way that the Q4 estimates will be out early December where they are going to significantly increase both module sales, revenue and hopefully profit margin. This is a critical chess move to maximize the valuation of Jinko shares in the US, so that the IPO price in Shanghai can be set as high as possible. If the timing between meeting requirements on STAR SSE (Shanghai Stock Exchange), registration process, IPO price setting by SSE and first day of trading is similar to Daqo’s, then for Jinko this would be late Sept 21, early January 22, late January 22, and mid-February 22, respectively. The key is that between Q4 estimates in December and price setting of IPO shares late January, the US investment big shots respond to their Q4 results and move this stock past $100. Otherwise, we longs are going to be diluted by a lot more than we should be if the market were even remotely logical with JKS stock. Jinko has done everything possible to make themselves and US shareholders get rich with their stock.

How to raise the share price?The problem:Market capitalisation in USD:Longi: 65bnTongwei: 25bnJaSolar: 12bnTrina Solar: 8bnJinkosolar: 2bn The fastest and most efficient solution is laid out in the mail below to JKS Investors Relation.If you want to move the stock upwards you should send an mail to JKS instead of writing here...Dear Sir or Madam, JinkoSolar has a persisting low market valuation compared to its china listed peer group. This makes the company potentially vulnerable and poses an unnecessary threat to success. JinkoSolar announced to list Jiangxi Jinko at China STAR market to get better access to capital markets after enduring the complex listing procedure. Not the missing China listing is what is standing in the way to raise the Mcap, it is more the fact to be listed on NASDAQ where Chinese solar stocks have traditionally a detrimental existence. As long as the US are responsible for the fate of the share price of JKS there won´t be a sustainable base. JinkoSolar is listed in Germany as well and has a very enthusiastic supportive community which provides a trade volume of several hundred thousand shares on good days, more than enough given the actual free float. The daily trading of JKS stock always follows the same pattern which shows a positive trend until the US market opens the gates to the casino. Unfortunately there seems to be a long road until a china listing of the daughter company could provide some support for the JKS stock on NASDAQ - possibly. JKS´s Capex guidance for this year raises the question of an overloaden debt burden which itself suppresses the stock price and would lead to a very dilutive stock placement if necessary. This is a risk which a highly valued company (i.e. Longi) doesn´t have at all. The lack of this risk alone works like a bulletproof backstop for a plunging share price. JKS is currently in the opposite situation and exposed to any kind of price speculation. A hypothetical raise of 500mn USD capital by equity would mean in case of Longi an indiscernible dilution of less than 1%. To get the same amount of money, JKS had to issue additional 30% of its outstanding stock! This is a misfortune which can´t be compensated elsewhere. Therefore I would like to give you the advice to simply delist JKS from NASDAQ trading. This is no detrimental point for the company´s image. There are no big hurdles which would take time to realize this move. Any ADRs can easily be traded in Germany as well as in the US. The German TRADEGATE exchange is opened until the usual US closing. There is no timely extensive procedure of requirements to overcome. There is no costly redemption or conversion in the forefront. Even US customers of JKS´s solar products will certainly prefer a sound, well financed company which can offer competitive priced products instead of a company that sacrifices its edge to the notorious mispriced valuation on NASDAQ. When the announcement of this liberating shift is communicated reasonably there will rather be a sigh of relief than a meaningful share price dip and the bounce back of the JKS stock which is trading then mainly on TRADEGATE / Germany will be stellar - and based on a far more solid and predictable footing. There are many European green energy companies with far higher valuation thanks to their main listing in Germany. The market is by far big enough for any capital-requiring measures. There are a lot of influential german analysts in the financial media promoting JKS day by day to investors but any up-move to the stock price suffocates when NASDAQ opens. Most JKS investors - even in the US - would highly welcome to get rid of NASDAQ´s continuously bearish impact on "suspicious" Chinese stocks. The US bias towards China seems to be far from a turnaround and will further suppress JKS stock price, its company value and its refinancing abilities as long as the US listing keeps to be market making - irrespective of any achievements JKS provides.The fact that a high market capitalization itself accounts for the possible success of a company in today´s markets could be crucial for JKS to stay in the solar worlds´ well financed top tier. With respect to recent market developments in the solar industry as well as in the political environment and especially with respect to the financial markets´ stance to JKS, I would highly appreciate if you consider this remark seriously. I would appreciate your feedback. Kind regards,

The most obvious reason to push this stock price down is to make a killing in China. Anyone who doesn't catch on to this, must be blind or naive. Daqo has proven that the Shanghai IPO's fetch a massive premium, and that in China, these companies get valued as their peers do (Trina, JA Solar, Tongwei, Xinte, etc.) By pushing the price as low as possible, any hedge fund (could be Morgan Stanley, too, since the STAR IPO is not only available to Chinese investors) that can get in on that IPO can buy up an ever larger percentage of Jinko for practically nothing, and make a fortune the first day this baby trades in STAR. As I already posted, if the Jinko price can be kept around $40-50, they'll have to sell 25% or more to get the $1B capital they are looking to get, leaving us US longs with less than 50% of the company, but without any gurantees that arbitraging will happen. Focusing on the fourth quarter results, relative to consensus expectations, shipments and revenues were better and gross margin was also higher. So why are the results disappointing if you remove all the one time write-offs of obsolescence in plant and equipment and impairment in value of a solar project (which added $50 million to operating costs), and you eliminate all the “mark to market” noise created by the change in value of derivatives surrounding the convertible debt, then the item that stocks out like a very sore thumb in costs is SHIPPING. Yes the cost of shipping has more than doubled in the last few months and they were not able to pass it to their customers, perhaps for contractual reasons.But again, this is a short to medium term phenomenon, a legacy of the disruption caused by the pandemic.
